Date of experience : August 01, 2024

Apple ID password reset is literally a reason not to go near any Apple products.

Genuinely advise people to think twice about relying on anything running off Apple ID. As a "security measure" it takes three days to reset a password. My partner had her phone stolen and couldn't remember her password and we went to reset it assuming it would be the same as Google, etc, and do it straight away via email or security questions, etc, only to be informed it would take *three days*. This means three days before we can access Find My iPhone; three days before we can be sure the phone was stolen and not lost; three days of no access to any other Apple devices using her account. The customer service rep seemed to think this was a selling point, proudly boasting that for some who forget their ID it can take months. Months to access services you're paying for, because their security practices are proudly dysfunctional. Meanwhile people actually stealing phones get a head start if you forget your details. It has made what was already a difficult situation ten times worse, and upset everyone involved considerably. It's also interesting to note that Apple don't have a complaint section on their support site. They couldn't give a monkeys.
